paragraphs.context: And God said, 'Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years,

qas.question: What did God create to separate the day from the night?

answers.text: lights in the vault of the sky

qas.question: What were the lights in the vault of the sky supposed to serve as?

answers.text: signs to mark sacred times, and days and years

paragraphs.context: and let them be lights in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth.' And it was so.

qas.question: What did God want the lights in the sky to do?

paragraphs.context: God made two great lights - the greater light to govern the day and the lesser light to govern the night. He also made the stars.

qas.question: How many great lights did God make?
What was the greater light for?
What was the lesser light for?

paragraphs.context: God set them in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth,

qas.question: Where did God set the lights?

answers.text: in the vault of the sky

qas.question: What was the purpose of setting the lights in the vault of the sky?

answers.text: to give light on the earth
